Subjects: God, hymns to; hymns, to God
_description: William Herebert, ‘Conditor alme siderum’ — twenty-eight lines in 4- and 6-line stanzas

BLAdd46919.First Lines: Holy wrouhte of sterres brryhtOf ryht byleue aylastyng lyht…
BLAdd46919.Last Lines: …And also to þe holy gostand euer myd heom wone
BLAdd46919.Note: Six-line stanzas written with third line to right of first two; some four-line stanzas written two lines of verse per line of manuscript.
BLAdd46919.Attributed Author: Herebert (written by original hand to right of first line, f. 208)
BLAdd46919.Editions:
Brown,  Carleton Fairchild,
                        ed.  
             Religious Lyrics of the XIV Century.
         Oxford: Clarendon, 1924. 2nd ed., rev.: G. V. Smithers, Oxford,
            1952: 22-3.
Luria,  Maxwell Sidney,  and  Richard L. Hoffman, eds.  
             Middle English Lyrics.
         New York: Norton, 1974: 94-5.
